snippet: The London-based photographer Nadav Kander, who says he likes to photograph nakedness, trained that sensibility on China's Yangtze River, emerging with work that will be on display for the first time in New York.
abstract: The London-based photographer Nadav Kander, who says he likes to photograph nakedness, trained that sensibility on China's Yangtze River, emerging with work that will be on display for the first time in New York.

headline.main: On a Bleak River, Seeing Compassion and Beauty
